sen.j: 全国支配の担当である老中に対し、旗本や御家人の支配を軸とする将軍家の家政を担当した。
sen.e: While Roju were in charge of national affairs, Wakadoshiyori were responsible for the housekeeping of the Shogunate family which was centered on controlling Hatamoto (direct retainers of Shogun) and Gokenin (also direct retainers of Shogun, but generally speaking, lower-ranked than Hatamoto).

While Roju were in charge of national affairs, Wakadoshiyori were responsible for housekeeping of the Shogun family and mainly controlling Hatamoto (direct retainers of Shogun) and Gokenin (also direct retainers of Shogun, but generally speaking, lower-ranked than Hatamoto).

sen.j: 1633年（寛永10年） に、徳川家光が側近6人（松平信綱、堀田正盛、三浦正次、阿部忠秋、太田資宗、阿部重次）を日常の雑務を扱う「六人衆」としたことに由来する。
sen.e: This post was originated in that Iemitsu TOKUGAWA appointed his six close advisers, Nobutsuna MATSUDAIRA, Masamori HOTTA, Tadaaki ABE, Sukemune OTA, and Shigetsugu ABE, to the "Rokunin-shu" (six person) post for handling daily affairs.
sen.cmt: 文頭にウェッブでの表現から”1633年（寛永10年）”を追加してあります。
sen.e: This post originated in that Iemitsu TOKUGAWA appointed his six close advisers, Nobutsuna MATSUDAIRA, Masamori HOTTA, Tadaaki ABE, Sukemune OTA, and Shigetsugu ABE, to the "Rokunin-shu" (six persons) post for handling daily affairs in 1633.
sen.cmt: 複数化、E欄のコメントにある年号が抜けていたので、追加しました。
sen.e: This post originated in that Iemitsu TOKUGAWA appointed his six close advisers, Nobutsuna MATSUDAIRA, Masamori HOTTA, Tadaaki ABE, Sukemune OTA, and Shigetsugu ABE, to the 'Rokunin-shu' (six persons) post for handling daily affairs in 1633.

sen.j: しかし、そのうち4人は老中に昇進したため存在意義を失いにいったん廃止され、老中にその職務は吸収された。
sen.e: However, because four of them were promoted to Roju and consequently the meaning of the existence of the post was lost, the Rokuninshu post was abolished once, with the jobs absorbed in Roju.

sen.j: その後に、若年寄として復活した。
sen.e: Later, the post was restored as the Wakatoshiyori post.

sen.j: およそ4人を定員とし、老中・側用人などに出世するために経験する職となっていった。
sen.e: The number of the Wakatoshiyori members was roughly four, and it became customary that this post should be assumed before being promoted to Roju or Sobayonin (lord chamberlain)
The number of the Wakatoshiyori members was roughly four, and the post became a step for Roju or Sobayonin (lord chamberlain).
